text: Christopher Samuel "Kit" Bond (March 6, 1939 - May 13, 2025) was an American politician. He was the United States Senator from Missouri and a member of the Republican Party. Before his career in the U.S. Senate, Bond served two non- consecutive terms as Governor of Missouri, from 1973 to 1977 and from 1981 to 1985. He was previously State Auditor of Missouri from 1971 to 1973. Bond was born on March 6, 1939 in St. Louis, Missouri. In 1960 he graduated from Princeton University. He received a law degree from the University of Virginia School of Law. He was married to Linda Bond. Bond died in St. Louis on May 13, 2025, at the age of 86. ==References== ==Other websites== * Kit Bond Strategies LLP Category:1939 births Category:2025 deaths Category:Politicians from St. Louis, Missouri Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:United States senators from Missouri Category:Governors of Missouri Category:Princeton University alumni Category:20th-century American politicians Category:21st-century American politicians
